type.models: Living Circle non-character warbeasts
Reeves of Orboros, Tharn Bloodtrackers, Tharn Wolf Riders, Wolves of Orboros
Druid Wilder, Reeve Hunter, War Wolf, Wolf Lord Morraig

benefits.ingameeffect: One Wolves of Orboros unit gains Advance Move. (Before the start of the game but after both players have deployed, a model with Advance Move can make a full advance.)

For each Reeves of Orboros unit in the army, place one 4" AOE forest template anywhere completely within 20" of the back edge of Kaya's deployment zone after his army. Forest templates cannot be placed within 3" of another terrain feature, including other forest templates.
Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.

tiers.name: epic Kaya - Call of the Wild

type.models: Living Circle non-character warbeasts
Reeves of Orboros, Tharn Bloodtrackers, Tharn Wolf Riders, Wolves of Orboros
Druid Wilder, Reeve Hunter, War Wolf, Wolf Lord Morraig

benefits.ingameeffect: Heavy warbeasts in Kaya's battlegroup gain Advance Deployment.
Warpbom Skinwalkers gain Advance Move.(Before the start of the game but after both players have deployed, a model with Advance Move can make a full advance.)
Benefit: You gain +1 on your starting game roll.

type.models: Circle non-character warbeasts
Shifting Stones, Tharn units
Druid Wilder, Tharn solos

benefits.ingameeffect: Models in the army have concealment during the first round of the game.

Kayaâ€™s battlegroup gains Pathfinder and Treewalker during the first round of the game. (Models with Treewalker ignore forests when determining LOS. While in a forest, models with Treewalker gain +2 DEF against melee attack rolls and can advance through obstructions and other models if they have enough movement to move completely past them.)
Models/units with Heart Eater begin the game with one corpse token.

benefits.ingameeffect: You gain +l on your starting game roll.

type.models: Living Circle non-character warbeasts
Tharn Ravagers, Warpborn Skinwalkers
Tharn Ravager solos, Lord of the Feast

benefits.ingameeffect: Tharn Ravager units and the Lord of the Feast each begin the game with one corpse token.
Tharn Ravager models/units gain +2 SPD during your first turn of the game.
Warpwolves in Krueger's battlegroup gain Advance Move. (Before the start of the game but after both players have deployed, a model with Advance Move can make a full advance.)

type.models: Circle construct non-character warbeasts
Druids of Orboros, Druid Stoneward & Woldstalkers, Shifting Stones
Blackclad Wayfarer, Gallows Groves, Lord of the Feast

benefits.ingameeffect: For each Shifting Stone unit in the army, one warbeast gains Advance Deployment. Additionally, this army can include Eiryss, Mage Hunter of Ios as a Minion.

For each Blackclad Wayfarer, you can redeploy one model/unit after both players have deployed but before the first playerâ€™s first turn. The redeployed models must be placed on the table in a location they could have been deployed initially.
Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.

type.models: Circle construct non-character warbeasts, Megalith
Druids of Orboros, Druid Stoneward & Woldstalkers, Sentry Stones & Mannikins, Shifting Stones
Blackclad Wayfarer, Druid Wilder

benefits.ingameeffect: Sentry Stone & Mannikin units can be placed up to 20" from the back edge of Baldur's deployment zone.
Up to one warbeast in Baldur's battlegroup gains Advance Deployment for each Shifting Stone or Sentry Stone & Mannikin unit in the army.
Druid Stoneward & Woldstalker units gain Advance Move. (Before the start of the game but after both players have deployed, a model with Advance Move can make a full advance.)

type.models: Circle non-character construct warbeasts, Megalith
Druids of Orboros, Shifting Stones
Blackclad Wayfarer, Gallows Grove, Lord of the Feast
Celestial Fulcrum

benefits.ingameeffect: Shifting Stones units and Gallows Grove solos in the army can be placed up to 20" from the back edge of Baldur's deployment zone.
For each Druids of Orboros unit in the army, one Celestial Fulcrum battle engine gains Advance Deployment.
Heavy Warbeasts in Baldur's battlegroup gain +2 SPD during your first turn of the game.

Druids of Orboros, Tharn Bloodtrackers, Tham Bloodweavers, Tharn Wolf Riders, Shifting Stones
Blackclad Wayfarer, Druid Wilder, War Wolfes

benefits.ingameeffect: Friendly models/ units can begin the game affected by Morvahna's upkeep spells. These spells and their targets must be declared before either player sets up models. Morvahna does not pay focus to upkeep these spells during your first turn.
Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.

type.models: Circle non-character warbeasts
Druids of Orboros, Tharn units
Druid Wilder, Gallows Grove, Blackclad solos, Tharn solos
Celestial Fulcrum

benefits.ingameeffect: You can redeploy models/ units with Prey after both players have deployed but before the first player's first turn. The redeployed models must be placed on the table in a location they could have been deployed initially.
You gain +1 on your starting roll for the game.

Friendly models/ units can begin the game affected by Morvahna's upkeep spells. These spells and their targets must be declared before either player sets up models. Morvahna does not pay focus to upkeep these spells during your first turn.

type.models: Circle non-character living warbeasts
Tharn units
Tharn solos, Lord of the Feast

benefits.ingameeffect: For every two solos in the army, one heavy warbeast in Kromac's battlegroup gains Advance Move. (Before the start of the game but after both players have deployed, a model with Advance Move can make a full advance.)
Models in Kromac's battlegroup gain Stealth during the first round of the game.

type.models: Circle non-character living warbeasts, Ghetorix
Sentry Stone & Mannikins, Shifting Stones, Tharn units
Tharn solos

benefits.ingameeffect: For each Bloodweaver unit or solo in the army, up to one model in the army with Heart Eater gains one corpse token at the start of the game. The same model can gain multiple corpse tokens but cannot gain more corpse tokens than it could gain normally.

For each Sentry Stone & Mannikins unit in the army, place one 3" AOE forest template anywhere completely within 20" of the back edge of Kromacâ€™s deployment zone after terrain has been placed but before either player deploys his army. Forest templates cannot be placed within 3" of another terrain feature including other forest templates.

type.models: Circle non-character warbeasts
Druid Stoneward & Woldstalkers, Reeves of Orboros, Sentry Stone & Mannikins, Shifting Stones, Druid units
Blackclad Wayfarer, Reeve Hunters, War Wolves, Lord of the Feast

benefits.ingameeffect: Models in Mohsar's battlegroup gain Apparition during your first turn of the game. (During your Control Phase, place models with Apparition anywhere completely within 2" of their current locations. If this affects a unit, only models in formation can be placed.)

Druid Stoneward & Woldstalker units can be redeployed after both players have deployed but before the first player first turn. The redeployed models must be placed on the table in a location they could have been deployed initially.

For each heavy warbeast in Mohsar's battlegroup, place one 3" AOE anywhere completely within 20" of the back edge of Mohsar's deployment zone after terrain has been placed but before either player deploys his army. The AOEs are obstructions that block LOS and provide cover. They are structures with ARM 18 that leave play if they suffer 1 or more damage points.

type.models: Circle construct warbeasts, Circle heavy warbeasts
Druids of Orboros, Reeves of Orboros, Sentry Stones & Mannikins, Shifting Stones, Warpbom Skinwalkers

benefits.ingameeffect: Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.

Models/units in this army gain Stealth during the first round of the game.

type.models: Griffon warbeasts, Wold Guardian, Woldwarden, Woldwrath

Blackclad Wayfarer, Gallows Grove

benefits.ingameeffect: Models in your army gain Spell Ward during the first round of the game.

Blackclad Wayfarer solos gain Ambush. (You can choose not to deploy models with Ambush at the start of the game. If it is not deployed normally, you can put a model with Ambush into play at the end of any of your Control Phases after your first turn. When you do, choose any table edge except the back of your opponentâ€™s deployment zone. Place the model with Ambush within 3" of the chosen table edge.)
Your deployment zone is extended 2" forward.
